ygData.subject: RE: Trade of the Century..
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree... that original poster has to be one of the luckiest bards in Norrath.  I ve been _religiously_ auctioning for the MM drum for the past 5 levels.  Not
ygData.messageBody:
I agree... that original poster has to be one of the luckiest bards in
Norrath. I've been _religiously_ auctioning for the MM drum for the past 5
levels. Not a single response, word, hint, tease, etc, etc. Seriously, I
have never received even one inkling of a reply. Very, very frustrating. I
too think that I'm only going to get one when I kill the little rat myself -
and from what I understand, that won't be until I'm level 40+. Oh well...
such is life.

Desmei Sightblinder
Lvl 30 Bard (Povar)

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Steven S. Klug [mailto:sklug@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, October 12, 1999 3:35 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Trade of the Century..
>
>
> From: "Steven S. Klug" <sklug@...>
>
> ACK!! That's a great trade for sure! I'm level 28, and I
> have 1000 pp in
> the bank, just waiting to buy a drum. And I STILL haven't
> gotten one. :)
> Consider yourself extremely lucky!
>
> P.S. Of course now, that 1000pp will probably start going
> toward lambent
> armor. Maybe I'll just have to pry the drum out of the cold
> dead hands of
> the princess myself one of these days.
>
>
> Laluni Songhammer, 28th level bard of E'Ci
>
> At 04:18 PM 10/12/99 -0500, you wrote:
> >From: "Lange, Stephen" <SLANGE@...>
> >
> >[PREXUS-LEVEL 14 BARD]
> >
> [snipped]
> >
> >But lo and behold she said she would trade! We met in the
> W. Commonland
> >Druid ring and traded. I equipped it, and ZOOOOM!!!!! Off I
> went, wow, I am
> >still amazed at the speed. At 13 I can outrun people in
> JBOOTS, and have
> >outrun people with SOW. Its absolutely amazing how much
> ground I can get.
> >
> >Anyway, thats my tale.. hope it was entertaining.
> >
> >P.S. To date I have been able to save myself and 3 other people in
> >situations where SELO alone wouldnt have done it.
> >
> >>Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> toren@...
> with the subject lol.
> >
> Steven S. Klug
> -- sklug@...
